title: Week of Feb 9–15, 2026
summary: UI configurability: column chooser, comfort mode for accessibility, position persistence fix, and optimized signal columns.

features.title: Column Chooser
features.summary: Show or hide any column on the KRJ signals table — your selection is saved automatically
features.description:
A new columns icon in the KRJ toolbar opens a dropdown where you can toggle any column on or off. Your column selection is saved to your account and persists across sessions and devices.

This is especially useful as new signal types are added (like the optimized signal columns). You choose exactly what you want to see, and the table adapts. A “Reset to defaults” option at the bottom restores the original column set.

The column chooser is built as a reusable component — expect it on other tables soon.

features.title: Comfort Mode
features.summary: Toggle between compact and comfort density — larger text and touch targets for accessibility
features.description:
A new Comfort Mode toggle in the user menu switches the UI between two density levels.

Compact mode (the default for most pages) preserves the existing high-density trader layout. Comfort mode increases font sizes, button targets (44px minimum), and spacing for easier interaction.

In comfort mode, the KRJ signals table uses fluid scaling: font sizes and padding automatically adjust based on the viewport width and number of visible columns. Fewer columns means each one gets more room. The table fills the screen intelligently without requiring manual adjustments.

Your preference is saved to your account and applies across all pages.

features.title: Optimized Signal Columns
features.summary: New optimized signal variants available via the column chooser (hidden by default)
features.description:
Two new signal columns have been added to the KRJ column registry:

- **Optimized Signal** — current week signal using optimized thresholds
- **Last Week Opt Signal** — prior week optimized signal

These columns are hidden by default to keep the table clean. Toggle them on via the column chooser when you want to compare optimized vs. standard signals.

The columns will show data automatically as optimized signal calculations are rolled out in the CSV pipeline.

features.title: Position Box Persistence Fix
features.summary: Selected position boxes now reliably survive page refresh and tab switches
features.description:
Fixed a race condition that could cause your selected position boxes on the Account tab to reset when you refreshed the page or switched tabs.

The root cause was two competing save operations (selected tickers and manual tickers) that could overwrite each other. Both now use a centralized preferences context that batches changes into a single write, eliminating the race.

Your position box selections are now reliably saved and restored across sessions.

features.title: UI Preferences Infrastructure
features.summary: New centralized preferences context eliminates per-component save races
features.description:
Under the hood, a new UIPreferencesProvider context wraps the entire app. It loads all user preferences once on startup and provides them to every component via a React hook.

Instead of each component independently fetching and saving preferences (which caused race conditions), all preference updates flow through the context. Changes are debounced and batched into a single API call.

This infrastructure supports the column chooser, comfort mode, and all future UI configurability features without adding new database tables or API endpoints.
